	of queries.

	this problem.

	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt

Project "aegis.3.1", Change 15						Page 128
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.1", Delta 6, Change 15.

SUMMARY
	give substitution contexts a location

DESCRIPTION
	1. This change adds a filename and line number to substitution contexts.
	This assists debugging broken error messages.
	2. Thic change corrects a bug in aede, where an error message was not
	invoked correctly.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	build	modify	    2	      BUILDING
	build	modify	    2	      MANIFEST
	build	modify	    3	      Makefile.in

Project "aegis.3.1", Change 23						Page 136
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.1", Delta 16, Change 23.

SUMMARY
	aeibu -keep

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the -keep option (et al) to the aeibu command. This
	makes it agree with the documentation, which has always claimed that it
	could do so.  Note that this is not necessarily a sensible thing to do,
	as integrators who elect to keep it around probably don't have
	permissions to clean it up afterwards.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.3", Change 16						Page 207

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.3", Delta 12, Change 16.

SUMMARY
	add -no_wait flag

DESCRIPTION

	locks.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.3", Change 18						Page 212
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.3", Delta 7, Change 18.

SUMMARY
	aecpu -unchanged notices cross branch merge

DESCRIPTION
	This change causes aecpu -unchanged to notice when a cross branch merge
	has been performed,and leave the file in the change, even when the
	actual contents are unchanged.	This facilitates cross branch merging in
	a much more automatic fashion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aegis/aecpu.c

Project "aegis.3.6", Change 18						Page 263
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.6", Delta 11, Change 18.

SUMMARY
	aegis -clean

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the ``aegis -clean'' command, which cleans your
	development directory.
	1. delete all files not chnage source files
	1a. warn (-keep) or remove (-nokeep) regular files which occclude
	project files, and are not change files.
	2. repair symlinks, if in use
	3. warn about out-of-datechange files
	4. warn about unchanged files
	5. warn if any ,D files are out of date

	My thanks to Ralf Fassel <ralf@atg.venture.de> for this suggestion.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	create	    1	      aegis/aeclean.c
	source	create	    1	      aegis/aeclean.h
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aegis/main.c
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   aux/Howto.cook
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    lib/cshrc.in
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   lib/en/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
	source	create	    1	      lib/en/man1/aeclean.1

	source	modify	    5 -> 6    libaegis/arglex2.h
	test	create	    1	      test/00/t0074a.sh

SUMMARY
	add the --base-relative option

DESCRIPTION
	This change addss the -base-rel option, which says relative filesnames
	are relative to the base of the sourec directory tree, not the current
	directory.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	attempt an NT port.  (Such a port is still a long way off, because of
	security issues, however.)

Project "aegis.3.6", Change 25						Page 276
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.6", Delta 13, Change 25.

SUMMARY
	rmch correction

DESCRIPTION
	This change corrects a niggle in the RMCH paper, about gcc and
	dependency sniffing.

	My thanks to nbecker@fred.net for pointing this out.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES

Project "aegis.3.6", Change 30						Page 281
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.6", Delta 21, Change 30.

SUMMARY
	correct web interface

DESCRIPTION
	This change corrects the change list web page, which was giving the
	wrong developer name for some changes.

	"When a change has had a review_fail, the change is in being_developed
	state, and thus the report should list the developer of that change. It
	displays the last person in the history list however, which is the
	reviewer (and not the developer).  I suspect this also happens when a
	change has received an integrate_fail (although I did not verify this)"

	My thanks to Steef de Bruijn <S.de.Bruijn@Integrity.NL> for reporting
	this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

Project "aegis.3.6", Change 34						Page 285
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.6", Delta 25, Change 34.

SUMMARY
	aerm and modtime

DESCRIPTION
	This change causes the junk file created by aerm to have the same mod-
	time as the file in the baseline.  This ensures that build tools are not
	triggered by it, or at least triggered less.

	My thanks to Ralf Fassel <ralf@atg.venture.de> for this suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.

	interface.  The url-quote function quotes URL special characters, and
	the html-quote function quotes HTML special characters.

Project "aegis.3.8", Change 20						Page 319
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.8", Delta 10, Change 20.

SUMMARY
	don't use ftime

DESCRIPTION
	I am advised that ftime does not set timezone on all systems.  This
	change removes the use of the ftime system call, on those systems which
	have it.

	problem.

Project "aegis.3.8", Change 38						Page 340
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.8", Delta 28, Change 38.

SUMMARY
	RPM spec file

DESCRIPTION
	This change alters the generated RPM spec file, to use the %post script
	facility to set the numeric file ownerships, since RPM will not allow
	you to do this using the %attr facility.  Sigh.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.3.8", Change 47						Page 350
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.8", Delta 39, Change 47.

SUMMARY
	crlf

DESCRIPTION
	This changes improves Aegis' input functions, particularly the parser,
	to accept CRLF as a newline.  This improves portability to non-unix
	environments (particularly ones which aren't entirely ansi-c compliant).

	My thanks to Christian Goetze <cg@resolute.com> for this suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    common/mem.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    common/mem.h
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/file.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    libaegis/fopen_nfs.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    libaegis/fopen_nfs.h
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input.h
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/crlf.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/crlf.h
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/env.c
				      Moved from libaegis/lex/env.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/env.h
				      Moved from libaegis/lex/env.h
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/file.c
				      Moved from libaegis/lex/file.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/file.h
				      Moved from libaegis/lex/file.h
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/file_text.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/file_text.h
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/private.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/input/private.h

SUMMARY
	integrate_begin_exceptions

DESCRIPTION
	Thsi change adds the integrate_begin_exceptions field to the project
	config file.  This permits the use to specify files what are to be
	omitted when the integration copy/link is performed.

	this suggestion.

Project "aegis.3.9", Change 60						Page 405
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.9", Delta 38, Change 60.

SUMMARY
	database compress

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the ability to compress the Aegis database on writing.
	This is NOT the default as it uses more CPU, but for networked systems
	with high latency, this may produce substantial performance benefits,
	even after taking the decompression penalty into account.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    7 -> 8    aedist/receive.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aegis/aeca.c
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    aegis/aepa.c
	source	modify	   18 -> 19   etc/Howto.cook
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    fmtgen/parse.y
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    lib/en/man5/aecstate.5
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    lib/en/man5/aepattr.5
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    lib/en/readme/new.3.9.so
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/change/cstate/write.c
	source	modify	    8 -> 9    libaegis/change_bran.c
	source	modify	    7 -> 8    libaegis/change_bran.h
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/cstate.def
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/gonzo.c
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/pattr.def

Project "aegis.3.10", Change 21						Page 419
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.10", Delta 11, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	trojan_horse_suspect

DESCRIPTION
	This changeg adds the trojan_horse_suspect field to the project config
	file.  This field is used by aedist --receive to check if incoming files
	could contain trojan horses.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.3.11", Change 22						Page 439
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.11", Delta 11, Change 22.

SUMMARY
	symlink exception patterns

DESCRIPTION
	There are two config entries: symlink_exceptions and integrate_begin_
	exceptions.  integrate_begin_exceptions allows patterns.  symlink_
	exceptions does not allow patterns.  Even so, you specify patterns in
	the sample project.  I will try changing the str_equal to a gmatch (and
	swapping the arguments) in the build symlink routine.

	My thanks to David Brown <davidb@qualcomm.com> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

Project "aegis.3.15", Change 16						Page 471
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.15", Delta 5, Change 16.

SUMMARY
	debug link hassle

DESCRIPTION
	Compiling Aegis-3.15 fails due to linking errors (unresolved symbol
	references) if compiled with egcs-1.1.1 (aka gcc-2.91) using debugging
	option '-g' and *NO* optimization (no -Ox options). For example, set
	'CFLAGS=-g' in the Makefile.  Typical unresolved symbols are 'input_
	getc', 'input_name', 'output_filename', 'output_fputc'. I expect the
	same problem with other GCC versions which provide for inlining of C-
	functions (gcc-2.8.1).

	My thanks to Leo Razoumov  <lrazoumov@qualcomm.com> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    7 -> 8    libaegis/input.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    libaegis/output.c

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Mon May 10	pmiller
			13:25:10 1999
	develop_begin	Mon May 10	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.123 days.
			13:25:20 1999
	develop_end	Mon May 10	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.330 days.
			14:20:29 1999
	review_pass	Mon May 10	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.892 days.
			16:48:53 1999
	integrate_begin Mon May 10	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.414 days.
			23:30:13 1999
	integrate_pass	Tue May 11	pmiller
			02:36:19 1999

Project "aegis.3.15", Change 20						Page 476
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.15", Delta 8, Change 20.

SUMMARY
	whiteout

DESCRIPTION
	1. This change adds the -whiteout and -no-whiteout options to the aerm
	and aemv commands, and the whiteout_preference to the user preferences
	file.
	2. This change adds the whiteout_template field to the project config
	file.
	3. This change adds documentation to the aerm and aemv man pages
	regarding the presence and purpose of the whiteout files.

	My thanks to Wayne Collins <wcollins@entrenet.com> for prompting this
	work.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

	This change was caused by internal_bug.

Project "aegis.3.16", Change 12						Page 490
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.16", Delta 3, Change 12.

SUMMARY
	aedist

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes yet another ``user permissions not set'' bug in
	aedist.	 I've changed things around so that the os_become calls very
	very closely bracket the os_execute calls - easier to keep track of them
	that way.

	My thanks to Ole Engel <engel@tu-harburg.de> for reporting this problem.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

	------- -------- -------      -----------

	test	create	    1	      test/01/t0105a.sh

Project "aegis.3.18", Change 19						Page 512
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.18", Delta 7, Change 19.

SUMMARY
	aenf dir

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds code to cope with the case where aenf is given a
	directory on the command line.	Previously, this was handled horribly.
	It is now that case that all of the files below the directory will be
	added.

	My thanks to all of the users out there, far too numerous to mention,
	what asked for something to be done about this.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.3.18", Change 21						Page 515
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.18", Delta 10, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	automatic change number guessing

DESCRIPTION
	This change improves the change number guessing code, if one uses the
	`development_directory_template' config directive to change the devdir
	form from the normal form to something without a dot, the ability of ae
	commands to find the change goes away and one must set AEGIS_CHANGE or
	provide -c all the time.

	My thanks to Jerry Pendergraft <jerry.pendergraft@endocardial.com> for
	reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   libaegis/user.c

Project "aegis.3.18", Change 22						Page 516
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.18", Delta 8, Change 22.

SUMMARY
	branch aede

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a bug where aede on a branch would be allowed to
	proceed, even if there were changes awaiting development.

	My thanks to Marko Schuetz <marko@ki.informatik.uni-frankfurt.de> for
	reporting this problem.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt

Project "aegis.3.18", Change 25						Page 518
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.18", Delta 11, Change 25.

SUMMARY
	split lists

DESCRIPTION
	This change splits the lists out of aegis/ael.c and puts each one into a
	separate file below the libaegis/ael/ tree.  This means that adding a
	new list has less impact on the rest of the code.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.3.19", Change 12						Page 534
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.19", Delta 3, Change 12.

SUMMARY
	diff example

DESCRIPTION
	1. This change adds a diff example to the config.example directory.
	2. This change improves the Administrator section of the worked example
	to handle branches in a more descriptive (and useful) (and accurate)
	way.
	3. This change alters aenpr (and its man page) to accept --version=- as
	a way of saying ``no branches'' that survives the command aliasing.
	4. Each of the worked example sections points users to the User Setup
	section of the Tips and Traps chapter.	This is a good thing to do
	first, ebfore laucnhing into the example.

	My thanks to Peter Nann <pnann@syrinx.com.au> for these suggestions.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

Project "aegis.3.19", Change 35						Page 558
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.19", Delta 19, Change 35.

SUMMARY
	history file checksums

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds documentation to the History Tool chapter of the User
	Guide for how to add checksums to your history tool's history files, if
	it doesn't have them already.

	My thanks to Andrew Morton for suggesting this. My thanks to Larry McVoy
	for a colorful discussion about the long-term behaviour of repositories
	and the need for integrity guarantees stronger than those provided by
	the operating system.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.20", Change 10						Page 572
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.20", Delta 1, Change 10.

SUMMARY
	prepare for release

DESCRIPTION
	This change prepares Aegis for the next public release.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

Project "aegis.3.20", Change 11						Page 573
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.20", Delta 2, Change 11.

SUMMARY
	typos

DESCRIPTION

Project "aegis.3.20", Change 20						Page 582
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.20", Delta 10, Change 20.

SUMMARY
	cron vs signal bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a bug where Aegis misbehaves when called by cron. This
	is because cron sets SIGCHILD to SIG_IGN, and Aegis needs it to be SIG_
	DFL.

	My thanks to Tom Satter <tsatter@purecode.com> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aedist/main.c
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    aegis/main.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    lib/en/readme/new.3.20.so

Project "aegis.3.20", Change 33						Page 598
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.20", Delta 22, Change 33.

SUMMARY
	col: part 2: the front end

DESCRIPTION
	This change is part two of reworking the columnizing code. This section
	reworks the internal col_* interface.  This results in columns which are
	derived output_* classes, allowing re-use of the output_* and wide_
	output_* interfaces.

	As a result of th work, it would be possible (but NOT implemented in
	this change) to write comma separated value (CSV) output, or even direct
	HTML output.

	The immediate benefit is that the -UNFormatted option no longer
	truncates any of the fields, though it still only prints the first line
	of each column.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    aedist/list.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aedist/output/cpio.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aedist/output/cpio_child.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aedist/output/cpio_child2.c
	source	modify	   11 -> 12   aegis/ael.c
	source	modify	   29 -> 30   etc/Howto.cook
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    lib/en/readme/new.3.20.so
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/ael/change/by_state.c
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/ael/change/details.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    libaegis/ael/change/files.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    libaegis/ael/change/history.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/ael/change/outstand_all.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/ael/change/user.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/ael/formeditnum.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/ael/formeditnum.h

	Project "aegis.3.21", Delta 12, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	doco fix

DESCRIPTION
	1. This change adds commentary to os_edit, about idiot editors which
	insist on returning stupid exit statii.
	2. The examples for develop_end_notify_command develop_end_undo_notify_
	command review_pass_undo_notify_command now havre the correct number of
	arguments.

	of the project names.
	4. The config.example for 'rcs' now mentions the 'history_put_trashes_
	file = ignore;' option.

	subject line

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.22", Delta 21, Change 22.

SUMMARY
	aedist test attrs

DESCRIPTION
	This change makes aedist -receive honor the test flags in the change
	attributes. This could concievable cause problems when loose systems
	send changes to strict systems.

	My thanks to Kevin Brannen <kbrannen@gte.net> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.22", Change 26						Page 659
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.22", Delta 11, Change 26.

SUMMARY
	rmdir ENOTEMPTY

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds more errno values to be silent about after rmdir.
	Aparrently some OS implementations are brain0dead and return EEXISTS
	when they mean ENOTEMPTY.

	My thanks to Ralf Fassel for reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.22", Change 33						Page 666
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.22", Delta 23, Change 33.

SUMMARY
	aesub '${dd}' for change which is branch

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixed a bug where `aesub ${dd}' when applied to a change
	which is a branch, omitted the final /baseline form the path it
	reported.

	My thanks to Roland Meister <Roland_Meister@genua.de> for reporting this
	problem.

	Also, need to have aesub ${bl} work for completed changes, and also
	${dd} report the baseline for awaiting development and completed
	changes.  Sigh.	 It makes scripts easier, aparrently.

Project "aegis.3.23", Change 12						Page 684
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.23", Delta 3, Change 12.

SUMMARY
	RPM glitch

DESCRIPTION
	Aegis 3.22 introduced a change in the RPM .spec file that removed
	/usr/share/aegis/profile.  This was apparently in conjunction with
	adding
	/etc/profile.d/aegis to the package, which would be fine except that the
	latter file is just a symlink to the former, and the former is no longer
	part of the RPM...  Consequently, when you build and install an 3.2[23]
	over an earlier-version RPM, /usr/share/aegis/profile disappears out
	from under you.

	My thanks to Steven Knight <knight@baldmt.com> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    etc/spec.sh

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Tue Nov 14	pmiller
			12:04:14 2000
	develop_begin	Tue Nov 14	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.503 days.
			12:04:20 2000
	develop_end	Tue Nov 14	pmiller
			15:50:31 2000
	review_pass	Tue Nov 14	pmiller
			15:50:31 2000
	integrate_begin Tue Nov 14	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.710 days.
			15:50:40 2000
	integrate_pass	Tue Nov 14	pmiller
			21:10:02 2000

Project "aegis.3.23", Change 20						Page 691
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.23", Delta 7, Change 20.

SUMMARY
	libintl issues

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixed a problem with libintl.h on some platforms.  There was
	a problem on some platforms for which you has to explicitly get GNU
	Gettext and install it.	 In some cases, it dod noting, because the
	ENABLE_NLS symbol was not defined to be 1.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.23", Change 30						Page 700
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.23", Delta 14, Change 30.

SUMMARY
	test 38 vs locale

DESCRIPTION
	GNU sort (at least  textutils 2.0) is locale sensitive so test38 fails
	('a.o' and 'all' are swapped) with some LC_COLLATE values.  Adding LC_
	ALL=C export LC_ALL solved this.

	My thanks to Didier Gautheron <dgautheron@magic.fr> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	test	modify	    4 -> 5    test/00/t0038a.sh

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Thu Feb 22	pmiller
			20:37:12 2001
	develop_begin	Thu Feb 22	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.070 days.
			20:37:19 2001

Project "aegis.3.23", Change 39						Page 710
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.23", Delta 22, Change 39.

SUMMARY
	quoting

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a bug in the ${quote} substitution which incorrectly
	quoted the exclamation mark (!).  Unfortunately, quoting isn't at all
	simple, because you can't exclusively use single quotes or double quotes
	or backslash.

	This change also splits out the various functions within common/str.c,
	in an effort to make minor improvements in the size of some of the
	executables.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

	Project "aegis.3.23", Delta 26, Change 52.

SUMMARY
	cross branch merge

	project's edit number origin, rather than the change file's edit number
	origin.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.

	Add change detail viewer to tkaer

	with a single variable (nicer style but no functional change).

	Project "aegis.3.24", Delta 18, Change 31.

SUMMARY
	removing staff

DESCRIPTION
	This change make it so that users do not need to be in the /etc/passwd
	file in order to be removed.  (They still have to be to be added.)

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 11						Page 753
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 19, Change 11.

SUMMARY
	aedeu and timestamps

DESCRIPTION
	This change makese aede a little more generougs about cancelling build
	time stamps.  This is because the previous behaviour was: if a person
	has a change ended and then does aedeu, but nothing else, aegis insists
	on the full aeb/aet.. before aede again.

	My thanks to Jerry Pendergraft <jerry@endocardial.com> for this
	suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 12						Page 754
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 30, Change 12.

SUMMARY
	change file undo command

DESCRIPTION
	This change ...Should have sent this last week during that long thread
	about config
	strings on the mailing list. It might have made it into 3.25 ;^)

	Anyway how difficult would it be to differentiate
	change_file_command
	Such that commands which "undo" can be hooked differently than comands
	which "do"
	perhaps just the addition of
	change_file_undo_command = ;
	Who's presence would attach to the undo set of commands.

	Based on what most wanted during that thread, seems like the undo hook
	would cover almost any of those situations, plus a few that have been
	plaguing me for years.
	Jerry Pendergraft <jerry@endocardial.com>

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 18						Page 759
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 3, Change 18.

SUMMARY
	Add admin mode to tkaenc (user selection for immediate development)

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds a developer button (if the user is an administrator).
	This button allows the user to choose the developer of a change if Begin
	Development Immediately is selected. note: The button is disabled if
	Begin Development Later is selected and it is not created if the user is
	not an administrator.

	My thanks to Scott Finneran <sfinneran@lucent.com> for this
	contribution.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 20						Page 761
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 5, Change 20.

SUMMARY
	tkaenc dies if a non administrator selects begin immediately.

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a very silly bug where tkaenc crashes if a non-
	administrator selects the "immediately" radio button. This was because
	the -command for this button explicitly used the developer button widget
	(which of course does not exist if you are not a devloper). This change
	adds enable/disable button commands which first check if the button
	exists (regardless of admin status).
	My thanks to Scott Finneran <sfinneran@lucent.com> for this patch.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    7 -> 8    script/tkaenc.in

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 23						Page 764
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 7, Change 23.

SUMMARY
	add getuid() to report generator and make tkaenc use it.

DESCRIPTION
	This change modifies aereport to add a new in-built function, namely
	getuid. This function returns an integer ala getuid. The returned value
	corresponds to the user who invoked aereport.
	This value is then used as an index into passwd to retrieve the users
	login. It is used in preference to a shell call to whoami or id -un or
	(insert your *nix here) implementation. Standards are a wonderful
	thing... there are so many to choose from.
	My thanks to Scott Finneran <sfinneran@lucent.com> for this patch.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   lib/en/man5/aer.5
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    lib/wish/devs_list.rpt
	source	modify	    8 -> 9    libaegis/aer/func.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/aer/func/getuid.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/aer/func/getuid.h
	source	modify	    8 -> 9    script/tkaenc.in
	test	modify	    3 -> 4    test/00/t0023a.sh

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 27						Page 767
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 12, Change 27.

SUMMARY
	aeimport bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixed a problem in aeimport which creates branches with the
	wrong file actions for modified files.	This caused a problem at aede
	time, and another at aeipass time.
	The aede symptom has been fixed in a previous change, however the
	aeipass symptom (a defensive move) is also fixed in this change, because
	there will be branches out there in user land imported with the buggy
	aeimport.
	My thanks to Cesar Crusius <crusius@barcelonadesign.com> for reporting
	this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 29						Page 769
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 14, Change 29.

SUMMARY
	Add comment editor to tkaer (part2)

DESCRIPTION
	This change improves a number of tk/tcl things...
	tkaer:
	- adds a simple text editor widget to tkaer in the event of a review
	fail.(saves all of the hassles related to aerfail -edit in the
	background.)
	- Adds a new comments button to fire up the above widget
	- comments and details buttons now toggle the presence of the associated
	windows.
	- produces a nice little file list for the default comments list.
	- added a todo list at the top.
	- updated the URL for tkdiff.
	aebuffy:
	- added support for change_state dependant bindings. Presently the only
	one is a double-button-1 click fires off tkaer (for changes in review
	state).

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 33						Page 774
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 18, Change 33.

SUMMARY
	flush pages

DESCRIPTION
	This change causes a flush at each page boundary out of the report
	generator.  This makes some of the reports and lists look much more
	responsive.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 36						Page 776
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 25, Change 36.

SUMMARY
	Give aebuffy a command line option to specify the project.

DESCRIPTION
	This change gives aebuffy a command line option to specify the project
	which will be watched. This is handy when working in a sub-branch but
	wanting to keep an eye on other branches. eg. working on aegis.3.25.1
	but wanting to also keep an eye on aegis.3.25.2 & aegis.3.25...
	My thanks to Scott Finneran <sfinneran@lucent.com> for this patch.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 50						Page 779
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 20, Change 50.

SUMMARY
	awechown yourself

DESCRIPTION
	This change alters the chown permissions so that you may chown a change
	to yourself, even if you are not a project administrator.  This is
	because this is the simplest way to move a change's development
	directory.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 51						Page 780
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 23, Change 51.

SUMMARY
	$PWD

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds code to os_curdir to consult $PWD for the current
	directory, before consulting getcwd().	This seems to be done
	automatically in GNU libc, and is set automatically by a number of
	shells.	 Unfortunately, not all libc implementatiosn check PWD, and so
	automounters can confuse Aegis.	 This happens frequently on BSD.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    libaegis/os/pathname.c

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Fri May 18	pmiller
			15:45:18 2001
	develop_begin	Fri May 18	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.300 days.
			15:45:26 2001
	develop_end	Fri May 18	pmiller
			18:00:38 2001
	review_pass	Fri May 18	pmiller
			18:00:42 2001
	integrate_begin Fri May 18	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 1.000 days.
			18:00:50 2001
	integrate_pass	Mon May 21	pmiller
			09:23:40 2001

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 59						Page 792
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 38, Change 59.

SUMMARY
	optimizations, input_ty

DESCRIPTION
	This change rewites the input base class and the various derived classes
	to be more efficient. The efficiencies gained depend a great deal on
	your CPU architecture and the amount of physical memory you have.
	This change also fixes a nasty O(n**2) problem when Aegis merges the
	file lists for a branch and its ancestors. This makes many Aegis
	commands go significantly faster for large projects.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aedist/input/822wrap.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aedist/input/cpio.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aedist/input/cpio_child.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aeimport/format/rcs/lex.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    aeimport/format/sccs/gram.y
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aeimport/format/sccs/lex.c

Project "aegis.3.25", Change 63						Page 797
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.25", Delta 36, Change 63.

SUMMARY
	optimizations, project_file_list_get

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a nasty O(n**2) problem when Aegis merges the file
	lists for a branch and its ancestors. This makes many Aegis commands go
	significantly faster for large projects.
	This chnage also upgrades the optimizing to -O2, and copes with a gcc
	2.96 optimization error (caused aedist -rec tests to fail).
	This change also addes a bunch of missing include files, revealed by the
	gcc 2.96 upgrade.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aedist/header.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aedist/input/cpio_child.c
	source	modify	   16 -> 17   aedist/send.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aefind/tree/relative.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aeimport/main.c
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    aereport/main.c
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    aesub/main.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    common/str/cat_three.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    common/str/catenate.c

Project "aegis.3.26", Change 17						Page 808
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.26", Delta 8, Change 17.

SUMMARY
	aedist bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem where aedist -rec could not recognise the
	output of aedist -send -no-ascii-armor. The binary portion of the file
	was read and not unread, so the compression failed.

	This was caused by incomplete testing of the input_ty rewrite. A
	regression test has been added to cover the gap.

	My thanks to Jochen Schaeuble <psionic@psionic.de> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    aedist/input/822wrap.c
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    lib/en/readme/new.3.26.so
	test	create	    1	      test/01/t0135a.sh

Project "aegis.3.27", Change 11						Page 820
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.27", Delta 19, Change 11.

SUMMARY
	aepatch -send

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the aepatch program, used to send a receive patches to
	programs. Useful when people send patches to your projects.

	This change only implements the -send side of things, plus the skeleton
	for the rest.  The --receive will be implemented in a future change set.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

Project "aegis.3.27", Change 12						Page 822
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.27", Delta 8, Change 12.

SUMMARY
	wide_output_ty optimizations

DESCRIPTION
	This change optimizes the wide_output_ty class, and its derived classes.
	This saves 30 of the 66 cpu seconds, on the author's system.  (This
	doesn't take into account the time AWK takes to post-process the list
	during the Aegis build.)

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------

Project "aegis.3.27", Change 15						Page 824
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.27", Delta 3, Change 15.

SUMMARY
	aegis.spec bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem with the RPM spec file. It omitted all of
	the executables!
	My thanks to Steven Knight <knight@baldmt.com> for reporting this
	problem.

	The makefile constructed, and the spec file referenced, the /etc/
	profile.d/aegis.sh file.  It is supposed to be /etc/profile.d/aegis.sh.
	My thanks to Jelle Boomstra <nietsch@dds.nl> for reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    7 -> 8    etc/Makefi.file.sh
	source	modify	   13 -> 14   etc/Makefile.sh
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   etc/spec.sh

HISTORY

SUMMARY
	output_ty optimizations

DESCRIPTION
	This change rewites the output_ty base class and the derived classes to
	operate more quickly. In the `ael pf' test, it saved 12 of 115 seconds
	on the author's system.

	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.27", Change 21						Page 831
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.27", Delta 9, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	listing blank pages

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem with the output pagination.	 Recent changes
	had cased it to throw the occasional blank page.  This was caused by the
	need() functions not flushing first, and thus operate from an incorrect
	internal state.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

SUMMARY
	project config pattern explanations

	how each of the pattern fields are applied to file names.  The idea was

SUMMARY
	cgi vs downloads

	many browsers wanted to save downloaded ".ae" files as "aegis.cgi".

	failed to adequately insulate against users who are no longer in the

	problem.

Project "aegis.3.28", Change 17						Page 870
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.28", Delta 10, Change 17.

SUMMARY
	build time adjust, va;idation

DESCRIPTION
	There was a problem reported with brining in a first change when the
	field build_time_adjust_notify_command is defined in the config file and
	is pointing at a script which is in the first change. The reported
	problem was that integration does not pass since it tried to run the
	script just at the end of the integration and aegis seems to think that
	it should take it from the baseline (the script is surrounded with
	${Source} in the config file) while the baseline hasnt been built yet.

	My thanks to Mark Veltzer <mark2776@yahoo.com> for reporting this
	problem.

	The problem could not be reproduced. The test in this change confirms
	that the functionality works as intended.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

Project "aegis.3.28", Change 19						Page 872
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.28", Delta 5, Change 19.

SUMMARY
	apache on slackware

DESCRIPTION
	This change ...There is a problem on slackware machines in the lookup
	for the apache
	configuration files. in Slackware they are in : /var/lib/apache
	This needs to be changed in the configure script for aegis because it
	doesnt
	find the apache and as a result does not install the cgi script.
	(I don't know if this is relevant since it's been a long time since I
	used
	Slackware but I think the distro was 7.0). Still - I had a peek in the
	configure script and it already has a list of directories that it scans
	for
	apache in and I don't see the harm of adding the slackware convention
	too.

	My thanks to Mark Veltzer <mark2776@yahoo.com> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 19						Page 900
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 9, Change 19.

SUMMARY
	new branch vs symlinks

DESCRIPTION
	This change the aenbr command needs to populate the baseline with
	symlinks if create symlinks before integation build is true and delete
	symlinks after integration builds is false
	The aenbr(1) command now populates the new branch's baseline with
	symlinks if the project config file is set so that they would remain
	after an integration build.  This is more consistent with the aedb(1)
	behaviour in the same situation.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 22						Page 903
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 4, Change 22.

SUMMARY
	tkaer and tkaenc improvements

DESCRIPTION
	This change makes some improvements to tkaer and tkaenc:
	- tkaer: use TCL stderr redirection, avoid /dev/stdout
	- tkaer: don't use non-existing pathnames in config file
	- tkaenc: disable test exemption buttons if not an admin in the project
	Especially the last point can cause lots of trouble when developers try
	to exempt the tests when using tkaenc. The aegis error message is easily
	lost in the output noise in the info window.

	My thanks to Ralf Fassel for this contribution.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   script/tkaenc.in
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   script/tkaer.in

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 32						Page 914
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 19, Change 32.

SUMMARY
	copy whole file

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem with the copy_whole_file function. It
	restored the *wrong* modification time to the file.  This made a mess of
	the aeib(1) command when the link_integration_directory field of the
	project config file is false.

	My thanks to <John Darrington john.darrington@ot.com.au> for reporting
	this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 33						Page 915
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 21, Change 33.

SUMMARY
	awaiting review, part 6, developers_may_review vs develop_end_action

DESCRIPTION
	This change ensures that the developer_may_review project attribute
	cannot contradict the develop_end_action attribute.  In the case of a
	conflict, the older fields wins: the end action is set to "goto being
	reviewed".

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 50						Page 921
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 29, Change 50.

SUMMARY
	timesafe

DESCRIPTION
	This change has aecp -delta-date produce a warning if the time is in the
	future.	 This is because you could get a different answer for the same
	input at some point in the future.

	This is the "time safe" quality first described by Damon Poole
	<damon@ede.com>.  My thanks to Damon for this excellent idea.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 52						Page 923
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 26, Change 52.

SUMMARY
	bison .h defines

DESCRIPTION
	This change cope with recent GNU Bison changes.	 When you ask for bison
	to generate a .h file, it now also generates #ifdef insulation.	 The
	problem is that in some places, two grammars are used simultaneously
	with the same lexer, so the insulation needs to be edityied, just like
	the rest of the YY symbols.  Of course, if they'd actually *used* a yy
	symbol, this change wouldn't have been necessary.  Instead, they used Y_
	TAB_H, so extra sed arguments are needed.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   50 -> 51   etc/Howto.cook
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   etc/Makefi.file.sh

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Tue Nov 13	pmiller
			15:48:01 2001
	develop_begin	Tue Nov 13	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.462 days.
			15:48:02 2001
	develop_end_2ar Tue Nov 13	pmiller
			19:15:58 2001
	review_begin	Tue Nov 13	pmiller
			19:16:13 2001
	review_pass	Tue Nov 13	pmiller
			19:16:17 2001
	integrate_begin Tue Nov 13	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.062 days.
			19:16:25 2001
	integrate_pass	Tue Nov 13	pmiller
			19:44:17 2001

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 69						Page 937
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 42, Change 69.

SUMMARY
	i18n bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem in common/language.c where it always picks
	up the "aegis.po" file, no matter which program is running.  It should
	use progname_get() instead, to select the message catalogue bas on the
	program name.

	My thanks to Alexey Voinov <voins@voins.program.ru> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.3.29", Change 76						Page 943
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.3.29", Delta 50, Change 76.

SUMMARY
	is_temporary

DESCRIPTION
	This change makes the libaegis/gonzo.c::is_temporary function more
	generous about what it considers a temporary directory.	 This is only
	relevant in tetsing mode, and doesn't present a security risk.

	This change was motivated by the weird and wonderful symlinks OSF/1 use
	for their clustering (including /tmp).

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.1", Change 29					       Page 1092
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.1", Delta 12, Change 29.

SUMMARY
	lockfile mode

DESCRIPTION
	This change modifies the mode of the lockfile when it is created.  It
	appears that HP/UX over NFS can't cope with 0600 lockfile permissions.
	It needs to be 0666 (similar to Cygwin).
	This should not present a security problem, as the file is always
	truncated on opening.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    lib/en/howto/team_work.so
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    lib/en/man5/aelock.5
	source	modify	   13 -> 14   libaegis/lock.c

Project "aegis.4.1", Change 34					       Page 1097
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.1", Delta 11, Change 34.

SUMMARY
	more hooks

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds more hooks to give finer granularity than the change_
	file_command. These are new_file_command, new_file_undo_command, copy_
	file_command, copy_file_undo_command, remove_file_command, remove_file_
	undo_command, new_test_command, new_test_undo_command.

	The man pages for the file manipulation commands have been updated to
	reference the notification commands.  Weird how many years they have
	been missing from the man pages!

	Also, the missing aemvu man page has been added.

	My thanks to Ralf Fassel (1999) and Mark Veltzer (2002) for this
	suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

Project "aegis.4.1", Change 35					       Page 1099
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.1", Delta 9, Change 35.

SUMMARY
	symlink maintenance

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes some issues with symlink maintenance.	 Symlinks are
	read, and verified to point to the correct level in the view path.  This
	is particularly important after integrations which raise the level of
	some files from the trunk baseline into a branch baseline.

	My thanks to John Darrington <johnd@ot.com.au> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------

Project "aegis.4.1", Change 47					       Page 1112
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.1", Delta 27, Change 47.

SUMMARY
	aecp -delta bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a bug where the wrong version was retrieved from
	history, when the file was changed later in the branch BUT was unchanged
	at the time of the specified delta.

	The offending function, change_branch_deltadate_to_edit, has been
	removed. The fix was to use the more efficient (and already existing)
	project_file_roll_forward mechanism.

	My thanks to John Darrington for reporting this problem.

	This change also removes the inefficient and defective change_branch_
	delta_date_to_edit and change_branch_delta)_to_edit mechanisms, as they
	are no longer used anywhere.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   22 -> 23   aegis/aecp.c
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    aepatch/send.c
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    lib/en/readme/new.4.1.so
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    libaegis/change/branch.h
	source	remove	    1	      libaegis/change/branch/deldate2edit.c
	source	remove	    1	      libaegis/change/branch/delta2edit.c
	source	modify	   25 -> 26   libaegis/project.c
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   libaegis/project.h
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    libaegis/project/file.h
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    libaegis/project/file/roll_forward.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/project/file/version_path.c
	test	create	    1	      test/01/t0159a.sh

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Tue Feb 12	pmiller
			16:14:25 2002

Project "aegis.4.2", Change 11					       Page 1139
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.2", Delta 3, Change 11.

SUMMARY
	config file

DESCRIPTION
	This change makes it possiblt to specify a directory to contain project
	"config" file fragments.  This means that parts of the config file may
	be changed by a branch, but other fundamental things (such as history
	commands) can be left unchanged in the trunk.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.4.2", Change 16					       Page 1143
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.2", Delta 10, Change 16.

SUMMARY
	reports vs unredable .aegisrc

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem caused by users making their .aegisrc files
	unreadable to everyone but themselves.	The follwoing report
		columns({width = 1000;});
		auto name, email ;
		name= "fred";
		email = user[name].email_address;
	triggered a
		libaegis/os.c: 1373: user permissions not set (bug)
	problem if user "fred" has set his .aegisrc file to mode 600.  This
	problem has now been fixed.

	The problem is cause when subst_intl is called, either directly or
	indirectly, *outside* appropriate os_become/undo bracketing.  The $errno
	substitution often wants to know the user ID and group ID for error
	messages.

	My thanks to johnd@ot.com.au for reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/aer/value/uconf.c

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Thu Feb 28	pmiller
			11:43:09 2002
	develop_begin	Thu Feb 28	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 7.000 days.
			11:43:10 2002
	develop_end	Sun Mar 10	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 1.000 days.
			00:02:53 2002

			19:51:50 2002

Project "aegis.4.2", Change 18					       Page 1146
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.2", Delta 4, Change 18.

SUMMARY
	symlink bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem where the symlink farm was not being
	maintained correctly.  It was being tricked by symlinks in the viewpath
	"blocking" its view of the deeper files.  The dir_stack_walk code had to
	be changed to (optionally) ignore symlinks.

	Getting the code to do thge right thing AND look clean was a bit of a
	challenge.

	This change also fixes a number of flaws in the DEBUg code (mostly
	trace(()) calls) that stopped things compiling.

	My thanks to John Darrington for reporting this bug, and for the test
	script which demonstrated it so simply.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    lib/en/readme/new.4.2.so
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    libaegis/change/build/symlinks.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/change/history/label_commnd.c
	source	modify	   12 -> 13   libaegis/change/pconf/get.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/dir_stack.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/dir_stack.h
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/input/catenate.c
	test	create	    1	      test/01/t0161a.sh

	development directory''.  The operation should have been os_chmod_errok,

Project "aegis.4.2", Change 53					       Page 1174
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.2", Delta 28, Change 53.

SUMMARY
	string tokens

DESCRIPTION
	This change updates the parsing of Aegis' database files (and inoput
	files, such as the project config file, change attribute files, etc, to
	accept string constants in the was ANSI C does.	 In particular, two
	adjacent string constants are automatically catenated.	This means you
	can keep nice indentation even when your strings get too long, rather
	than use ugly backslash lines.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    lib/en/man5/aegis.5
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    libaegis/gram.y

Project "aegis.4.2", Change 56					       Page 1176
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.2", Delta 34, Change 56.

SUMMARY
	aedist patches

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds some of the aepatch functionality to aedist.
	Specifically, it adds patches to outgoing file modifications, so that
	these can be used in preference to the whole-file source if at all
	possible. This results in fewer messy merges at the receiving end (which
	doesn't have the necessary file version information to actually perform
	a merge).

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   29 -> 30   aedist/receive.c
	source	modify	   21 -> 22   aedist/send.c
	source	modify	    8 -> 9    aepatch/send.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    cklinlen/module.cook
	source	modify	   12 -> 13   lib/en/readme/new.4.2.so
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/output/bit_bucket.c

Project "aegis.4.2", Change 60					       Page 1181
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.2", Delta 35, Change 60.

SUMMARY
	aecp -ind vs completed branches

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a bug in aecp -ind, where it would give a ``there is
	no development directory'' error when you tried to extract a file
	version from history of a completed branch.

	The problem turned out to be more general.  When *anything* asks for the
	project search path, it is necessary to omit the baselines of completed
	branches.

	My thanks to John Darrington for reporting this problem.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   25 -> 26   aegis/aecp.c
	source	modify	   58 -> 59   etc/Howto.cook
	source	modify	    6 -> 7    libaegis/change/sch_path_get.c
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    libaegis/project/sch_path_get.c
	test	create	    1	      test/01/t0162a.sh

	from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.3", Change 17					       Page 1212
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.3", Delta 6, Change 17.

SUMMARY
	context diff parse bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a bug in the context diff parsing, where it would get
	the last hunk wrong if it was a hunk which deleted lines, due to
	incorrect end-of-file handling.

	This affected both aepatch -receive and aedist -receive, because aedist
	now includes patches for better merge behaviour.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for reporting this problem.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

Project "aegis.4.3", Change 21					       Page 1216
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.3", Delta 9, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	gettext cruft

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds a completely redundant .po file for the benefit of a
	brain-dead server being used by the internationalization teams.	 Their
	robot needs an "i18n/everything.pot" file, rather than have it split
	into the "lib/en/LC_MESSAGES/*.po" files.  Sheesh.

	The probelm with this approach, for anyone who can't work it out is
	1. what happens when things other than .po files get translated?  It
	makes no sense to say "just cantenate together all your man pages and
	reference manuals", so why does it make sense to catenate together all
	of the .po files?
	2. what happens when things other than .po files get translated?  Where
	do you put them?  man1/aegis.1 and then man1/aegis.en.1?  By using a
	directory tree lib/LANG/blahblah this falls out cleanly.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   16 -> 17   etc/archive.cook
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   etc/i18n.cook
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   lib/en/release/main.man

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Wed May	 8	pmiller
			08:47:26 2002
	develop_begin	Wed May	 8	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.153 days.
			08:47:27 2002
	develop_end	Wed May	 8	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.183 days.
			09:56:23 2002
	review_pass	Wed May	 8	pmiller
			11:18:32 2002
	integrate_begin Wed May	 8	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.050 days.

	integrate_pass	Wed May	 8	pmiller

SUMMARY
	aegis.cgi

	was being determined at the wrong time. Now it is installed into
	$bindir, and users can copy it if they want to (a symlink woiuld serve
	them better).

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.3", Change 29					       Page 1227
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.3", Delta 13, Change 29.

SUMMARY
	aepatch

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes aepatch to be more robust about change numbers in the
	patch header.  If the change number has already been used, it now
	automatically chooses trhe next available change number.  The change
	number in the header was always intended to be advisory.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

Project "aegis.4.4", Change 18					       Page 1248

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.4", Delta 7, Change 18.

SUMMARY
	aeannotate, part 3

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds an annotate_diff_command field to the project config
	file, rather than use the patch_diff_command, which defaults to a
	context diff and is thus too wide and gives misleading results.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.4", Change 39					       Page 1275
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.4", Delta 25, Change 39.

SUMMARY
	Russian error messages

DESCRIPTION
	Fixes for russian translation. Previous patch somehow was converted to
	cp1251 charset. Probably by some russian mailserver. So all russian
	messages fixed in that patch showd as garbage. Now I have gziped patch
	so noone tries to convert it. New patch also fixes some typos I found.

	My thanks to Alexey Voinov <voins@voins.program.ru> for this patch.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.4", Change 51					       Page 1277
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.4", Delta 27, Change 51.

SUMMARY
	editor and pager user preferences

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds 3 new fields in ~/.aegisrc: editor_command, visual_
	command and pager_command. They (almost) duplicate enviroment variables
	EDITOR, VISUAL and PAGER but for aegis only. Now I can use aegis
	specific options in that commands. For example: I usually want vim to
	create backup files, but when I edit some change or project attrbiutes
	that leaves backup files from temporaries in my homedir. So I put
	following line in ~/.aegisrc: visual_command = "vim -c 'set nobackup'".

	My thanks to Alexey Voinov <voins@voins.program.ru> for this patch.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------

SUMMARY
	aencu bug

	This change fixes a problem with the aencu command. It is now explictly
	stated in the man page that any project administrator, or the creator of
	the change, may delete a change.  The code now matches the man page.

	My thanks to Brendan J Simon <brendan.simon@bigpond.com> for reporting
	this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	This change was caused by external_bug.

Project "aegis.4.5", Change 23					       Page 1295
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.5", Delta 13, Change 23.

SUMMARY
	split os.c

DESCRIPTION
	This change splits the last of libaegis/os.c into separate pieces.  The
	idea is that it gives the linker more opportunities to leave stuff out.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

Project "aegis.4.5", Change 25					       Page 1297
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.5", Delta 12, Change 25.

SUMMARY
	aesub $baserel, again

DESCRIPTION
	This change makes baserel accept more than one file name as arguments.

	The capitalize, dirname, dirname_rel, downcase, env, identifier, length,
	namemax and upcase substitutions now also accept more than one argument.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_improvement.

Project "aegis.4.6", Change 32					       Page 1336
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.6", Delta 19, Change 32.

SUMMARY
	aegis under aegis

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes some build problems, so that other developers at other
	wise can develop Aegis using Aegis.

	- PDF documents are only created if Cook can find ps2pdf, psselect and
	ptx.
	- tarball sare only created if Cook can find tardy
	- The etc/CHANGES.[34] files are replaced by a single etc/CHANGES file,
	so the actual branch numbers are now irrelevant.
	- the Howto be a Developer chapter now has the right aenbr instructions,
	and mentions the architecture issues (which should be mostly gone,
	because of recent aeca -fa and aedist -rec changes).
	- the gettext .mo files are only built if the magcat command can be
	found (this being the best way to also determnine if msgfmt --compendium
	ialso exists).

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   aegis/aedb.c
	source	modify	   68 -> 69   etc/Howto.cook
	source	modify	   19 -> 20   etc/archive.cook
	source	create	    1	      etc/documents.cook
	source	create	    1	      etc/howtodevnbr.sh
	source	modify	   13 -> 14   etc/i18n.cook
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   lib/en/howto/developer.so
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   lib/en/howto/main.ms
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    lib/en/readme/new.4.6.so
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    lib/report/chan_detai.rpt
	source	create	    1	      lib/report/proj_detai.rpt

Project "aegis.4.6", Change 33					       Page 1338

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.6", Delta 18, Change 33.

SUMMARY
	aedist -rec fix arch

DESCRIPTION
	This change causes aedist -receive to call aeca -fix-arch whenever the
	config file is in a change set.	 This fixes most of the new-user "change
	contains architectures NOT in config file" problems.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.7", Change 35					       Page 1378
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.7", Delta 20, Change 35.

SUMMARY
	aeimport bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem in aeimport.  The symptom was that aecp -
	delta misbehaved.  The probelm was that the first delta needed a
	timestamp *prior* to the first change set taken from the import sets.

	My thanks to Corey Stup <Corey@Stup.net> for reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.

Project "aegis.4.7", Change 36					       Page 1379
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.7", Delta 21, Change 36.

SUMMARY
	CSS for aegis.cgi interface

DESCRIPTION
	Thsi change adds markup to the aegis.cgi reports so that they can make
	use of style elements in accordance with http://www.w3.org/TR/1998/REC-
	CSS2-19980512 .

	This change should not change the default appearance of the web pages,
	but users/ administrators are now able to customise the style of the
	pages according to local or project specific desires.

	My thanks to John Darrington for this change set.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.
