Project "aegis.4.8", Change 36					       Page 1416
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.8", Delta 25, Change 36.

SUMMARY
	aet progress messages

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the aet -progress and -noprogress options. The aet -
	progress prints messages about how far it progressed in testing. Useful
	with non-numeric test names.

	Progress messages can be turned on with -PROGress option and turned off
	with -Not-PROGress option. Default is -Not-PROGress. The last one is in
	effect. For batch_test_command two new optional substitutions available:
	${Total} is the total number of tests
	${Current} is the number of first test in batch.

	batch_test_command itself is responsible for displaying appropriate
	messages for individual tests. Aet displays message before each external
	command run: for test_command before each test, for batch_test_command
	before each batch.

	My thanks to Alexy Voinov for this patch.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   23 -> 24   aegis/aet.c
	source	modify	   12 -> 13   lib/de/LC_MESSAGES/libaegis.po
	source	modify	   38 -> 39   lib/en/LC_MESSAGES/libaegis.po
	source	modify	   13 -> 14   lib/en/man1/aet.1
	source	modify	   41 -> 42   lib/en/man5/aepconf.5
	source	modify	   31 -> 32   lib/en/man5/aesub.5
	source	modify	    7 -> 8    lib/fr/LC_MESSAGES/libaegis.po
	source	modify	   17 -> 18   lib/nl/LC_MESSAGES/libaegis.po

	source	modify	   23 -> 24   libaegis/arglex2.c

	to review fail comments.

Project "aegis.4.8", Change 69					       Page 1441
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.8", Delta 42, Change 69.

SUMMARY
	/etc/mailname

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds code to use /etc/mailname if no email_addres sentry is
	found in .aegisrc, and if /etc/mailname exists. The /etc/mailname file
	is use by Debian to set the default email domain name.

	My thanks to John Darringto for this suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.9", Change 11					       Page 1465
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.9", Delta 4, Change 11.

SUMMARY
	configure vs gnu diff

DESCRIPTION
	This change has./configure determine if ti is talking to GNU diff.  This
	is then used to add --ascii to the aeimport diff command.

	My thanks to Cyrille <bollu@awtce.be> for reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

	This change was caused by external_bug.

Project "aegis.4.9", Change 15					       Page 1468
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.9", Delta 5, Change 15.

SUMMARY
	command line too long

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes adist -rec, aepatch -rec and aetar -rec, so that they
	break some of their commands into palatable size pieces, otherwise there
	is a risk of "command line too long" errors from exec().

	My thanks to Normaln <aegis@nlin.net> for reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

Project "aegis.4.9", Change 18					       Page 1472
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.9", Delta 7, Change 18.

SUMMARY
	aerpass/fail vs develop_end_action changing

DESCRIPTION
	This change copes with the transition case when a project changed from
	develop_end_action = goto_being_reviewed; to develop_end_action = goto_
	awaiting_review; while having changes in 'being reviewed'.

	This made aerpass and aerfail problematic for changes which were in the
	"being reviewed" state, because they could not do anything except aedeu.

	This change allows the "old" rules to apply to such changes (for
	transitions in both directions).

	My thanks to Kurt Hewig for reporting this problem.
	This change fixes SourceForge bug 620137.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   20 -> 21   aegis/aerf.c
	source	modify	   15 -> 16   aegis/aerp.c

HISTORY

Project "aegis.4.9", Change 21					       Page 1475
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.9", Delta 9, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	aeipass vs aeimport remove files

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem with aeimport and removed files.
	1. aeipass has been changed to cope with the symptom of the problem, for
	existing projects which were seeded using aeimport.
	2. aeimport now deals with removed files correctly, creating more
	correct change file state and project file state records.  It now
	reconstructs the baseline exclusively from project file state
	information.
	My thanks to Cyrille <bollu@awtce.be> for reporting this problem.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

	Changed semantics of `File List' in webiface

Project "aegis.4.10", Change 11					       Page 1524
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.10", Delta 8, Change 11.

SUMMARY
	aetar vs executable

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes aetar so that it includes executable permissions with
	files which are executable.

	My thanks to Aryeh M. Friedman <aryeh@m-net.arbornet.org> for reporting
	this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------

	source	modify	    6 -> 7    aetar/send.c

	What		When		Who	 Comment

			12:27:13 2002

Project "aegis.4.10", Change 21					       Page 1534
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.10", Delta 20, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	Improved test exemption handling

DESCRIPTION
	This change improves the way that changes are given and rescinded test
	exemptions.
	In particular:
	1. After a change has been made test_exempt=false due to aecping a test,
	if that test is aecpu'd, the change reverts to its original exemption
	status.
	2. If all tests in a project are aecp'ed, then the change becomes
	regression test exempt until at least one test is aecpu'ed

	My thanks to John Darrington for this patch.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   18 -> 19   aegis/aeca.c
	source	modify	   35 -> 36   aegis/aecp.c
	source	modify	   25 -> 26   aegis/aecpu.c
	source	modify	   20 -> 21   aegis/aenc.c
	source	modify	   14 -> 15   lib/en/man5/aecstate.5
	source	modify	   30 -> 31   libaegis/change.h
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/change/test/fce_reg_expt.c

Project "aegis.4.10", Change 61					       Page 1562
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.10", Delta 37, Change 61.

SUMMARY
	aeintegratq improvements

DESCRIPTION
	This change removes lockfile creation from aeintegratq and for each
	change in queue check state just before attempting aeib on it. This will
	prevent failure due to someone doing aerpu, etc, while the queue is
	running.

	My thanks to Jerry Pendergraft for this patch.

	This change fixed SourceForge bug 587008.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 13					       Page 1604
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 23, Change 13.

SUMMARY
	Add optional username arg to list_default_project() and list_user_
	changes()

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the ability to specify a username for the above two
	functions.

	Note that in libaegis/user.c, this changeset includes a whole bunch of
	K&R insulation removal.	 The only functionality change in this file is
	the addition of user_default_project_by_user() and the modification of
	user_default_project().

	user_default_project_by_user() has been added, to contain most of what
	user_default_project() used to contain.	 This was done so that a million
	calls to user_default_project() did not need to be modified to add a
	zero (default user) argument.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for this patch.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   18 -> 19   aegis/ael.c
	source	modify	    8 -> 9    lib/en/man1/ael.1

	source	modify	    2 -> 3    libaegis/ael/project/default.c
	source	modify	   27 -> 28   libaegis/user.c
	source	modify	   11 -> 12   libaegis/user.h

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 14					       Page 1606
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 29, Change 14.

SUMMARY
	Added the architecture_discriminator_command field

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the architecture_discriminator_command field to the
	project "config" file, a mechanism to arbitrarily discriminate between
	`architectures' on the the physical machine.  This is useful if you want
	to consider a library version to be part of an architecture.

	My thanks to John Darrington <john@cellform.com.au> for this
	contribution.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------

	source	modify	   31 -> 32   libaegis/change.h
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/change/architecture/name.c
	source	create	    1	      libaegis/change/architecture/run_disc_
				      cmd.c

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 24					       Page 1619
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 25, Change 24.

SUMMARY
	Add optional username arg to list_default_change() and list_outstanding_
	changes()

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the ability to specify a username for the list_default_
	change() and list_outstanding_changes() functions.

	list_changes_in_state_mask_by_user() has been added, to contain most of
	what list_changes_in_state_mask() used to contain. This was done so that
	a million calls to list_changes_in_state_mask() did not need to be
	modified to add a zero (default user) argument.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for this patch.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 38					       Page 1631
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 13, Change 38.

SUMMARY
	add args to list funcs

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds the ability to specify extra arguments for "list"
	functions.

	This is unsuitable for many of the list functions, but will be helpful
	for some. In particular, a username could be passed to the list_user_
	changes() function.

	aegis/ael.c:struct table_ty now contains a maximum number of extra
	arguments allowed for each of the list functions.

	The initialisation of aegis/ael.c:table[] now contains the expected
	number of max arguments for each list function. For those that are non-
	zero, subsequent changesets will allow those functions to accept a
	username as the extra arguments.

	To allow easy future expansion, where some functions may want two or
	more extra arguments, the args are assembled into a string_list_ty list,
	the address of which is passed into the appropriate list function.

	Unfortunately, this changeset has to touch many, many files. However,
	the only real functionality change is contained in aegis/ael.c

	Assuming this concept is acceptable, appropriate list functions will be
	able to process their extra arguments in later changesets.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for this patch.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    1 -> 2    aeannotate/list.c
	source	modify	   17 -> 18   aegis/aeclean.c
	source	modify	   39 -> 40   aegis/aecp.c
	source	modify	   26 -> 27   aegis/aecpu.c
	source	modify	   24 -> 25   aegis/aed.c
	source	modify	   12 -> 13   aegis/aedn.c
	source	modify	   17 -> 18   aegis/ael.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aegis/aemt.c
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    aegis/aemtu.c
	source	modify	   19 -> 20   aegis/aemv.c

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 42					       Page 1638
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 45, Change 42.

SUMMARY
	C++ preparation: minimal compilation

DESCRIPTION
	This change is the next of many in the move to C++-ify aegis. It
	modifies enough files to allow fmtgen to build, with "-x c++" as a
	compiler option (of course, this compiler option change is not part of
	this changeset).

	Modifications consist mainly of adding casts.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for this patch.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 62					       Page 1661
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 34, Change 62.

SUMMARY
	etc/archive.cook integration build.

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem in the etc/archive.cook file during
	integration build.

	The problem is with the example-cook-fhist-baseline and example-make-
	rcs-baseline variables.	 If the example-cook-fhist and example-make-rcs
	projects do not exist, then the output of the collect function call is
	"aegis: project "example-cook-fhist" unknown".	This is then used as the
	target of a recipe.

	The fix I've done is to direct stderr to /dev/null rather than stdout.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for this patch.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   27 -> 28   etc/archive.cook

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------

			09:34:44 2003

			09:34:45 2003

			10:07:21 2003
	integrate_begin Mon Jun	 2	pmiller
			10:07:23 2003

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 69					       Page 1670
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 38, Change 69.

SUMMARY
	change_file_command bug

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a bug in the change_file_command was not being called.
	This bug was introduced when the {new,copy,remove}_file_command fields
	were added to the project copnfile file.  The commands were not
	defaulted correctly.

	My thanks to Jerry Pendergraft for reporting this problem.

	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 75					       Page 1676
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 43, Change 75.

SUMMARY
	C++ preparation: Don't use "this" as a variable/argument name

DESCRIPTION
	From: mlee@klaxoniqa.com
	Date: Mon Jun 16 08:52:06 2003
	Warning: the original change was in the 'being_developed' state

	This change renames occurrences of "this" as a variable/argument name.
	"this" is a reserved word in C++.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.

	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

SUMMARY

	found.

	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 77					       Page 1686
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 46, Change 77.

SUMMARY
	deleted_by

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a very old compatability problem.  If "deleted_by is
	set, the the file action should be "remove", but in some trunks (from
	some 3.x versions of Aegis) the action is "create"

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    etc/autoconf.cook
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    libaegis/change/file/fstate.c
	source	modify	   30 -> 31   libaegis/project.c

Project "aegis.4.11", Change 78					       Page 1687
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.11", Delta 58, Change 78.

SUMMARY
	obfuscate addresses on web pages

DESCRIPTION
	This change gently obfuscates the email addresses on the web pages to
	foil spam collecting bots.

	My thanks to <a href="mailto:Jelle Boomstra
	%3Cnietsch%40dds.nl%3E">Jelle Boomstra &lt;nietsch&#64;dds.nl&gt;</a>
	for this suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name

	source	modify	    6 -> 7    etc/windowsnt.html

Project "aegis.4.12", Change 21					       Page 1734

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.12", Delta 22, Change 21.

SUMMARY
	delta dir symlink hook

DESCRIPTION
	The aeipass command now sets the AEGIS_INTEGRATION_DIRECTORY environment
	variable before running the integrate_pass_notify_command, so that you
	can add a symlink for compilers which insist on placing absolute paths
	into debugging information in object files.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	behaves as documented.

	and aexml.

Project "aegis.4.12", Change 26					       Page 1740
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.12", Delta 16, Change 26.

SUMMARY
	aerm vs aenf and aent

DESCRIPTION
	The way aenf and aent work have been made more generous. It is noe
	possible to aerm a file and then aenf or aent the same file in the same
	change.	 This is usefule for changing the type of a file.  Previously
	this has to be done as two consecutive changes.

	My thanks to Steven Knight <knight@baldmt.com> for this suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 15					       Page 1766
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 2, Change 15.

SUMMARY
	mention aeget on Aegis web site.

DESCRIPTION

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 19					       Page 1770
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 7, Change 19.

SUMMARY
	always switch file action

DESCRIPTION
	All uses of file_action_ty has been change to use switch statements.
	This affords us the opportunity to let GCC give a warning (error) when a
	new file usage is added, making it less likely that implications of such
	a decision are overlooked.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 28					       Page 1780
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 13, Change 28.

SUMMARY
	smarter -change

DESCRIPTION
	The -Change option now accepts more than just a change number.	It now
	accepts many forms similar to those used by the ${version} substitution,
	allowing its output to be used directly as command line input; forms
	such as -c 1.2.C34 and --c=5.6.D78 are now understood to imply a --
	branch option as well as either --change or --change-from-delta,
	respectively.  In addition, you may prepend a project name, to imply the
	--project option as well; form such as -c aegis.4.15.C28 are understood.

	The executable actually go 11KB smaller (!) while increasing
	functionality with this change.	 Additional refactoring of command line
	option handling may be worthwhile.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 31					       Page 1784
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 17, Change 31.

SUMMARY
	more C++ preparation (fmtgen:struct)

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a poor implementation decision dating from 12 years
	ago.  Fmtgen now produces slightly different type names, in preparation
	for changing to C++.  The problem was that it produced a struct and a
	typedef of the name name, but they were actually different types, and
	the C++ compiler barfed (correctly).

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   16 -> 17   aeannotate/annotate.c
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    aecomplete/complete/change/file.c

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 32					       Page 1792
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 18, Change 32.

SUMMARY
	more C++ preparation (fmtgen:list)

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a poor implementation decision dating from 12 years
	ago.  Fmtgen now produces slightly different type names, in preparation
	for changing to C++.  The problem was that it produced a struct and a
	typedef of the name name, but they were actually different types, and
	the C++ compiler barfed (correctly).

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the development directory. This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_improvement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   39 -> 40   aedist/send.c
	source	modify	    3 -> 4    aeget/get/file/metrics.c
	source	modify	   30 -> 31   aegis/aeib.c
	source	modify	   42 -> 43   aegis/aeip.c
	source	modify	   12 -> 13   fmtgen/type/list.c
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   libaegis/aer/list.c
	source	modify	   12 -> 13   libaegis/aer/parse.c

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 33					       Page 1794
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 19, Change 33.

SUMMARY
	aedist -send -delta bug

DESCRIPTION
	A bug has been fixed in aedist and aepatch which caused an assert
	failure (or segfault) when you tried to send a file which had been
	created and removed in a branch, and after the branch was integrated
	only a remove record exists in the parent branch.

	My thanks to Walter Franzini <walter@sys-net.it> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   40 -> 41   aedist/send.c
	source	modify	   21 -> 22   aepatch/send.c

			12:43:49 2004

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 35					       Page 1795
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 20, Change 35.

SUMMARY
	aedist -send -delta -es bug

DESCRIPTION
	A bug has been fixed in aedist and aepatch which would cause an
	assertion failure (or segfault) when you tried to aedist -send -delta -
	es files which did not exist at that delta.

	My thanks to Walter Franzini <walter@sys-net.it> for reporting this
	problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

Project "aegis.4.15", Change 95					       Page 1811
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.15", Delta 4, Change 95.

SUMMARY
	always switch file usage

DESCRIPTION
	All uses of file_usage_ty has been change to use switch statements.
	This affords us the opportunity to let GCC give a warning (error) when a
	new file usage is added, making it less likely that implications of such
	a decision are overlooked.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	patch metadata

DESCRIPTION
	The aepatch(1) command now includes meta-data as a compressed BASE64
	encoded block at the top of the patch, after the human-readable text but
	before the file.  This means that patches can be as effective as aedist
	is transmitting chaneg sets.  Patches without meta-data still work as
	before.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   47	      aedist/send.c
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    aepatch/arglex3.c
	source	modify	    5 -> 6    aepatch/arglex3.h
	source	modify	   22 -> 23   aepatch/receive.c
	source	modify	   26 -> 27   aepatch/send.c
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   lib/en/man1/aepatch.1
	source	modify	   10 -> 11   libaegis/input/base64.c
	test	modify	    4 -> 5    test/01/t0136a.sh
	test	modify	    1 -> 2    test/01/t0166a.sh
	test	modify	    1 -> 2    test/01/t0167a.sh
	test	modify	    1 -> 2    test/01/t0168a.sh
	test	modify	    1 -> 2    test/01/t0195a.sh

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 25					       Page 1934
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 25, Change 25.

SUMMARY
	aedist -send -compatibility

DESCRIPTION
	The aedist -send command has a new -compatibility option, use to
	indicate the version of the *receiving* aedist program.	 This, in turn,
	selects the features which may be added to or omitted form the generated
	.ae file.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 16, Change 29.

SUMMARY
	change file nth viewpath

DESCRIPTION
	The change_file_nth and change_file_find functions have been enhanced to
	take a view path argument, much like the project_file_nth and project_
	file_find functions.  This allows straightforward unioning of the
	development directory with the branch and ancestor baselines.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 30					       Page 1944
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 47, Change 30.

SUMMARY
	file attributes, part 3, aefa

DESCRIPTION
	There is a new aegis --file-attributes (aefa) command, allowing
	arbitrary attributes (name value pairs) to be attached to files.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

FILES

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 35					       Page 1949
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 24, Change 35.

SUMMARY
	file_usage_config, part 2

DESCRIPTION
	The new "config" file usage is now usewd to locate project configuration
	files.

	It is now possible to move project configuration files.

	It is now possible to remove project configuration files, provided there
	is at least one left.

	The aeimport command can now avoid files which have the same name as the
	default project configuration file ("aegis.conf" or "config") and use
	something else.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 19, Change 37.

SUMMARY
	better config file error messages

DESCRIPTION
	This change inserts the file name and line number into structures read
	from Aegis meta-data.  This permits much better error messages when the
	data is checked for semantic errors.

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	multi-assign

	more than once.	 This can be useful where the configuration file is
	split into several pieces on several branches.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 51					       Page 1961
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 22, Change 51.

SUMMARY
	delta dir symlinks

DESCRIPTION
	This change adds a symlink from the delta directory to the baseline once
	it has been renamed.  This helps lots of (idiot) programs which insist
	on burying absolute paths into executables.

	My thanks to Jerry Pendergraft for this suggestion.

	This change must pass a full regression test.  This change is exempt
	from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 69					       Page 1983
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 40, Change 69.

SUMMARY
	[876149] Fix for aedist -r with non existent file, some docs and a typo

DESCRIPTION
	$ /usr/bin/aedist -r -f /tmp/foo
	aedist: open "/tmp/foo": Success

	The error is due to mem_alloc setting errno=0.
	This change save and restore the old value.

	This change add some docs in doxygen format to common/mem.h.

	This change fix a type in lib/en/man5/aepcona

	This change fixes SourceForge issue 876149
	My thanks to Walter Franzini for this change set.

Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 43, Change 72.

SUMMARY
	test 126 hangs

DESCRIPTION
	A bug has been fixed which caused aetar to hang (actually, many things
	which consulted LDAP or NIS) because the reserved symbol "send" was
	being overloaded.  The reserved symbol "clone" was also being
	overloaded.   Both have been fixed.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 86					       Page 1999
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 57, Change 86.

SUMMARY
	BSD build issues

DESCRIPTION
	This change fixes a problem building Aegis on alpha machines.  There was
	an #ifdef in common/ac/time.h aimed at OSF/1, mistakenly using __alpha__
	, this has been removed until someoneon DEC alpha OSF/1 finds a bvuild
	problem.

	The second problem was with the search order for -I compler arguments.
	The CFLAGS has been moced to after these in thegenerated Makefile, to
	ensure that Aegis' includes are searched first.

	My thanks to Christopher Vance <vance@aurema.com> for reporting these
	problems.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    common/ac/time.h
	source	modify	   19 -> 20   etc/Makefi.file.sh

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Sat Mar 20	pmiller
			10:34:57 2004
	develop_begin	Sat Mar 20	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 1.826 days.
			10:34:59 2004

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 96					       Page 2008
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 66, Change 96.

SUMMARY
	Solaris vs aedist

DESCRIPTION
	aedist uses the "diff" command to do some of its work, and gives it the
	"-L" option.  This option is not supported on the version of diff
	installed on the operating system I am using:
	uname -iprsvm
	SunOS 5.9 Generic_112233-11 sun4u sparc SUNW,Ultra-60
	I've attached a patch which moves the "-L" options passed to diff into
	the gnu-diff-only conditionally compiled section.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for this patch.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    4 -> 5    libaegis/change/diff/run_patch.c

HISTORY
	What		When		Who	 Comment
	------		------		-----	 ---------
	new_change	Wed Mar 31	pmiller
			11:10:18 2004
	develop_begin	Wed Mar 31	pmiller	 Elapsed time: 0.028 days.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 106				       Page 2018
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 75, Change 106.

SUMMARY
	aerb vs aedeu

DESCRIPTION
	When changes are in the being reviewed state, and Aegis has been
	configured tio use the awaiting_review state, the aedeu command may not
	be used.  This is so that reviewers don't waste their time reviewing
	changes which have been returned to development.  Think of the change as
	"belonging" to the reviewer while in the being_reviewed state.

	My thanks to Matthew Lee for reporting the problem, and to Jerry
	Pendergraft for the solution.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_enhancement.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	   24 -> 25   aegis/aedeu.c
	source	modify	    9 -> 10   lib/en/man1/aedeu.1

HISTORY

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 109				       Page 2021
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 79, Change 109.

SUMMARY
	aepatch -send bug

DESCRIPTION
	A bug has been fixed in aepatch.  It was creating empty patches for some
	changes in completed project branches.	This also affected aedist -send
	and aecp -delta and aecp -rescind in some cases.  It was caused by a
	subtle flaw in the non-detailed case for the project_file_roll_forward
	function.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_bug.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 111				       Page 2023
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 84, Change 111.

SUMMARY
	aeget files view

DESCRIPTION
	The files view of the aeget web interface now accepts options to control
	the page contents.  The simplest view allows recursive fetch of project
	sources using wget or similar, with no extraneous links to confuse the
	results.  Previous behavior is preserved by the aeget-generated links.

	My thanks to Walter Franzini for this suggestion.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 121				       Page 2034
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 92, Change 121.

SUMMARY
	aeannotate bug

DESCRIPTION
	A bug has been fixed in the way invalid sequences of multi-byte
	characters are handled by the internationalization code.  This
	potentially affected all reports, listings and error messages.	The
	symptom was that aeannotate listings could sometimes have a blank source
	code column.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 96, Change 129.

SUMMARY
	aedist bug, use --no-template

DESCRIPTION
	A bug has been fixed in aedist where one of the --new-file commands was
	missing a --no-template argument.  Under some circumstances, this
	resulted in change sets which could not be aedist -received.

	problem.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 131				       Page 2046
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 100, Change 131.

SUMMARY
	uuid, part 8, copy basic file attributes

DESCRIPTION
	All of the places which copy basic file attributes (usage, attributes
	and uuid) have been updated to use the same function, ensuring that
	additional file attributes in future will be easier to add.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by internal_enhancement.

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 155				       Page 2059
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 112, Change 155.

SUMMARY
	uuid, part 13, lift directory name restriction

DESCRIPTION
	As a consequence of the UUID being used to generate history file names,
	there is no longer the restriction that new files may not be named after
	the directory portion of a deleted file (or vice versa).

	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.

SUMMARY
	curl error codes

DESCRIPTION

	understood.  The ./configure script also looks for the new curl_easy_

Project "aegis.4.16", Change 168				       Page 2071
Change Details						Thu Jun	 3 05:50:43 2004

NAME
	Project "aegis.4.16", Delta 126, Change 168.

SUMMARY
	Gettext tracking

DESCRIPTION
	This change copes with some recent Gettext changes.

	The newer version of xgettext inserts a "Report-Msgid-Bugs-To" header
	into msgid "", and msgmerge understands this, and merges it into the
	output.	 For anyone playing with msgmerge, it is important to remember
	that Report-Msgid-Bugs-To and POT-Creation-Date are taken from the .pot
	files, and the value in the .po file is ignored.

	My thanks to Matt Lee for reporting this problem.

	This change is exempt from testing against the development directory.
	This change is exempt from testing against the baseline.


ARCHITECTURE
	This change must build and test in the "linux-i486" architecture.

CAUSE
	This change was caused by external_bug.

FILES
	Type	Action	 Edit	      File Name
	------- -------- -------      -----------
	source	modify	    2 -> 3    etc/i18n.clean.sh
	source	modify	   28 -> 29   lib/de/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
	source	modify	   58 -> 59   lib/en/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
	source	modify	   14 -> 15   lib/es/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
	source	modify	   21 -> 22   lib/fr/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
	source	modify	   34 -> 35   lib/nl/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
	source	modify	   16 -> 17   lib/ro/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
	source	modify	   30 -> 31   lib/ru/LC_MESSAGES/aegis.po
